intro: Cleistanthus amaniensis, commonly known as the East African cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially threatened species.
